item.title: From Shadows to Sustainability: Why Indoor Cannabis Cultivation Is a Prohibition-Era Relic Unfit for a Legal Market
item.description:
Executive Summary

The legal cannabis industry has emerged as a transformative force in American agriculture and culture. Yet, despite its progress, many practices still reflect the legacy of prohibition. Chief among them is indoor cultivationâ€”a model born out of fear and secrecy during the height of the War on Drugs. Today, that outdated model exacts an enormous environmental cost. This white paper explores how indoor growing became standard, the ecological damage it causes, and how the industry can evolve toward a sustainable future.
